alert.note: Alert for Aransas Islands; Bee; Calhoun Islands; Coastal Aransas; Coastal Calhoun; Coastal Nueces; Coastal Refugio; Coastal San Patricio; Goliad; Inland Nueces; Inland Refugio; Inland San Patricio; Nueces Islands (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 7:38PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Aransas, southwestern Calhoun, central Nueces, San Patricio, south central Goliad, Refugio and southeastern Bee Counties through 830 PM CDT... At 738 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Papalote to near Copano Village to 8 miles southeast of Aransas National Wildlife Refuge. Movement was southwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Corpus Christi, Portland, Robstown, Rockport, Sinton, Port Aransas, Taft, Refugio, Woodsboro, Seadrift, Corpus Christi International Airport, Lamar, Ingleside, Aransas Pass, Odem, Gregory, St. Paul, Ingleside On The Bay, San Patricio and Bayside. This includes the following highways... Interstate 37 between mile markers 1 and 27. US Highway 181 between mile markers 612 and 648. US Highway 183 between mile markers 658 and 668. US Highway 77 between mile markers 612 and 658. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
